title: Hemogenic Endothelium Differentiation from Human Pluripotent Stem Cells in A Feeder- and Xeno-free Defined Condition
procedures:
1. Reagents
Cell lines (human PSCs): obtain either embryonic stem cells (ESCs) or iPSC lines 409B2 and 201B7(317-9)) and CBA11.
Reagent preparation
PSC plating medium: mix PSC maintenance medium with 10 µM Y-27632 and store at 4 °C.
PSC Spheroid tiling medium: mix PSC maintenance medium with 625–1,250 ng/mL human recombinant Laminin-511 E8 fragment (LM511-E8)(depending on cell line) just prior to use.
NOTE: LM511-E8 can be mixed in media15. Other matrix such as full-length laminin-511 needs to be pre-coated, and even did so, they do not sustain mesodermal organoids adhered during differentiation process.
Day 0 differentiation medium: mix Mesodermal basal medium with 2 µM CHIR99021, 80 ng/mL Bone morphogenetic protein 4 (BMP4) and 80 ng/mL Vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF).
Day 2 differentiation medium: mix Hemogenic basal medium with 1 µM SB431542, 80 ng/mL VEGF and 100 ng/mL Stem cell factor (SCF).
Prepare phosphate buffer saline (PBS) without calcium or magnesium (See Table of Materials).
1 mM ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) buffer: add 1 mL of 0.5 M EDTA to 500 mL of PBS.
EHT medium: mix Hematopoietic basal medium with 50 ng/mL SCF, 20 ng/mL thrombopoietin (TPO), 50 ng/mL Fms-related tyrosine kinase 3 ligand (Flt-3L), 20 ng/mL Interleukin-6/Interleukin-6 receptor alpha (IL-6/IL-6Rα), insulin-transferrin-selenium-ethanolamine, L-glutamine and Penicillin/Streptomycin/Amphotericin B.
FACS buffer: mix PBS with 2% fetal calf serum and 1 mM EDTA.
Prepare magnetic separation buffer (See Table of Materials).
Prepare methylcellulose-based media (See Table of Materials).
2. PSC Colony Formation
Grow hPSCs to 70 – 80% confluency on a 0.5 µg cm-2 LM511-E8-coated 6-well plate in mTeSR1 in a 37 °C incubator with 5% CO2.
PSC dissociation (Day -4)
Aspirate the medium and wash the cells with PBS twice. Rinse the cells with dissociation solution. Incubate at 37 °C for 15 min (cells will not desiccate in this time).

Suspend the cells in PSC maintenance medium, transfer the suspension to an appropriately sized tube and centrifuge the cells at 200 x g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant and suspend the cells in PSC plating medium.
Plate the PSC suspension at a density of 48,000 – 70,000 cells cm-2 (depending on the cell line) onto a micro-fabricated plastic vessel and incubate overnight in the 37 °C incubator with 5% CO2.
NOTE: We recommend 100 μL well-1 of cell suspension in a 96-well micro-fabricated plastic vessel. You will typically seed 20,000 cells well-1 in a 96-well plate to yield approximately 100 spheroids.
Tiling PSC spheroids on LM511-E8 (Day -3)
Collect the PSC spheroids in a 15 mL conical tube by gently pipetting using P1000 micropipetter and leave the spheroids to stand at room temperature for 2 min to precipitate by gravity. Aspirate the supernatant.
Suspend in spheroid plating medium, dispense the suspension into a non-coated 6-well culture plate at a density of 4-spheroids cm-2 and culture in the 37 °C incubator with 5% CO2 for three days.
3. Hemogenic Induction (Day 0)
Aspirate the medium, add Day0 differentiation medium and culture in the 37 °C incubator with 5% O2 and 5% CO2 (hypoxic incubator).
After two days of culture in Day0 differentiation medium, aspirate the medium, then add Day2 differentiation medium and culture in the hypoxic incubator.
4. Isolation of Hemogenic Endothelium (Day 4)
Two days later, aspirate the medium and wash the cells with PBS twice. Rinse the cells with dissociation solution. Incubate in the 37 °C incubator with 5% CO2 for 30 min.

Gently suspend the cells in 1 mM EDTA to dissociate to the single-cell level, transfer the suspension into a 50 mL conical tube and centrifuge the cells at 200 x g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant and suspend the cell pellet with 300 µL of magnetic separation buffer.
Add 100 µL of CD34+ microbeads and gently pipet. Incubate for 30 min at room temperature. Up to 20 million cells per 100 μL CD34+ beads can be used.
Filter the suspension through a 40 µm cell strainer.
Separate the CD34+ cells using a magnetic separator.
5. Induction of Endothelial-to-hematopoietic Transition (EHT)
Fibronectin coating
Prepare the required volume of 5 µg/mL fibronectin-coating solution by diluting 1 mg/mL fibronectin in PBS.
Dispense 0.5 mL of the coating solution into each well of a 24-well culture plate. Incubate the plate at room temperature for 30 min.
Centrifuge the sorted CD34+ cells at 200 x g for 3 min. Resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of EHT medium.
Determine the viable cell density with the cell counter. Adjust the cell density to 200,000 cells mL-1 by adding EHT medium.
Aspirate and discard the coating solution from the fibronectin-coated well. Dispense 0.5 mL of CD34+ cell suspension into each fibronectin-coated well.
Incubate in the hypoxic incubator for one week.
6. Flow Cytometry Analysis of Hematopoietic Cells
Floating cell collection: Transfer the culture medium to a 15 mL conical tube. Centrifuge the medium at 200 x g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant.
Adherent cell collection
Wash the cells with 0.5 mL of PBS twice.
Rinse the cells with dissociating solution and aspirate the surplus liquid.
Incubate the plate in the 37 °C incubator for 5 min.
Resuspend the cells in 1 mL of FACS buffer.
Mix the floating cells and adherent cells.

Centrifuge the cells at 200 x g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant. Resuspend in 50 µL of FACS buffer. Incubate the cells with anti-CD34 and anti-CD45 antibodies for 1 h at room temperature in the dark.
Wash the cells with PBS twice and centrifuge at 200 x g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant and resuspend in 0.5 mL of FACS buffer with 0.5 µg/mL 4',6-diamidino-2-phenylindole.
Measure CD34 and CD45 expression by flow cytometer.
7. Colony Forming Unit (CFU) Assay of Hematopoietic Cells
Hematopoietic cell collection: Transfer the medium from the culture to a 15 mL conical tube. Gently rinse the well twice with PBS.
Centrifuge the cells at 200 x g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant. Resuspend in 1 mL of EHT medium. Determine cell number with the cell counter.
Add a suspension volume equivalent of 10,000 cells to 3 mL of methylcellulose-based media supplemented with antibiotics and mix well 5 times with a 16 G or 18 G syringe.
Dispense the whole methylcellulose-based media suspension into each well of a 6-well plate.
Incubate in the 37 °C incubator with 5% CO2 for two weeks while keeping moist. Do not disturb the dish. Colonies are motion-sensitive.
After two weeks, count the colonies under a microscope.
